item.title: Jensen & Co. caught in U.S.-China trade war crossfire—again
item.description: Jensen Huang has 4 trillion reasons to smile. But geopolitical instability is making it tougher by the day.

item.title: Remote work isn’t the problem. Mediocre leadership is

item.title: Is ‘Quiet Cracking’ Just a New Term for Burnout? It Still Says Important About Work Today
item.description: The two phrases might have the same causes and cures, which is why business leaders still need to pay attention to the newer buzzword.

item.title: For one man, the war against Cracker Barrel never really ended

item.title: Edible Arrangements Is Taking Its THC Delivery Service Nationwide
item.description: Under new CEO Somia Farid Silber, the company known for fruit bouquets is now shipping hemp-derived THC products around the country.

item.title: Samsonite Just Reinvented the Suitcase
item.description: Samsonite’s new Paralux suitcase is the first hardshell bag to add this nifty feature. Move over, Away.

item.title: The Fed’s Own Economists Disagree Where the Economy Is Heading
item.description: The Fed cut rates, but there’s no consensus on what comes next for policy.

item.title: DBS CEO dinner auction in Singapore fetches $15,000 bid
item.description: The winning bid—more than double the pre-sale estimate—underscores how experiences are increasingly prized in Singapore’s luxury market.

item.title: Markets got what they wanted from Powell with a Fed rate cut and they’re still not happy
item.description: Jerome Powell delivered a 25bps rate cut, but Wall Street’s muted reaction reflects concern it was a risk move on jobs, not confidence.
